book.synopsis: From Michael Cunningham, the Pulitzer Prize-winning author of The Hours, comes this widely praised novel of two boyhood friends: Jonathan, lonely, introspective, and unsure of himself; and Bobby, hip, dark, and inarticulate. In New York after college, Bobby moves in with Jonathan and his roommate, Clare, a veteran of the city"s erotic wars. Bobby and Clare fall in love, scuttling the plans of Jonathan, who is gay, to father Clare"s child. Then, when Clare and Bobby have a baby, the three move to a small house upstate to raise
